section.name: Information
section.p: I plan to release a snapshot version of XPontus 1.0.0-pre1 in early 2008. It will a Java Web Start only release with as less bugs as possible. It will allow me to get a quick feedback before the official release.

section.name: Overview
section.p: XPontus XML Editor is a simple XML Editor with lots of features. It aims to become "the" free alternative to commercial XML IDES such as XMLSPy or Oxygen XML Editor, or Exchanger XML Editor.

I focus the development on simplicity and speed. I try to optimize the code for low specs pcs. This is why most features will be available as modules. The editor will never become a monster beast with 100mb to download at least for now :-0.

section.name: About the new branch
section.p: This is a complete rewrite of the previous beta and release candidates. Lots of new features were requested again and again. It was very difficult to add new features in a modular manner without touching the code base. I learned a lot from my first coding attempts and I feel more experienced now. I hope that the brand new version will be great. The latest news about XPontus development can be found on my blog.

section.name: Features
section.p: XPontus tries to provide you the features you would expect in a real XML IDE in a familiar and conviviable manner.
I work on the usability and look at other applications to inspire myself when I design the application. So when you choose to use XPontus XML Editor, you are not completely lost.
XPontus is not just an XML Editor no more, it is becoming a framework with pluggable modules. The plugin framework used to create XPontus plugins is JPF.
